properties.Note: Black bear got into some garbage; no further incidents reported as of May 13th
Black Bear broke into shed with several weeks of accumulated smelly garbage at a Cowley Creek Subdivision residence. Bear was hazed from residence by a CO. [WH-13-024]
Bear tore into storage tent in Wolf Creek Campground. Food was left in tent meant only for food storage, but wasn't in proper containers. Bear chased away by teacher using 2 bear bangers.

Black bear attracted by garbage bins and fed on garbage. Conservation Officers immobilized this bear in a nearby playground and relocated it. Note other backyard attractants including BBQ, petroleum products, recyclables and backyard compost. To avoid wildlife conflicts, the public is advised to ensure all potential attractants and sources of food for bears be secured from easy access in well-built sheds.  Backyard composting should be avoided.

Sub-adult female black bear relocated. The trap has been reset at the same location as there is an ongoing complaint of a bear (maybe more than one) frequenting residences there.Video clip to be attached later.
Bear broke into camper at 9pm, got a bag of food from inside. Owner called neighbour, who shot the animal. [WH13-043]
Black bear attempted to break into house. Owner's son drove bear away by blowing vehicle horn.
Black Bear shot, try to enter house…owner try scaring animal away by shooting above but end up hitting the Bear accidently….he found Bear dead next day, where he saw it walked away it looked ok…
